job_title: Anonymous Employee in Lexington, SC
pros: Pay was fair. Benefits were fair. "Business partners" seem to really listen and provide constructive feedback.
cons: The team leaders, managers, and director level leadership are a far cry from the representation of the LMC culture within the community that I was raised to aspire being a part of. There is a very large trickle down effect a closed unsupportive team culture where each person is not willing to help others and only carries there own agenda as a priority. Knowledge sharing in a respectful manner is non-existent. Most staff are close guarded with the knowledge and resources they have access to, as to be viewed as a sole nonexpendable source. Very cutthroat environment.

review_title: Helped me realize that nursing homes likely aren’t my niche
job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Columbia, SC
pros: The differentials are nice, especially when doing weekend shifts. Coworkers are mostly chill, nurses are understanding and helpful. Everyone is doing their best to retain what help they can get.
cons: Medical insurance cost is way too much. So understaffed that I hardly felt I could give my clients any sense of ease from their isolated lives. Had to be so quick with my tasks that it hardly left any time to connect with the people I perform my tasks for. Considering that many of these people are here 24/7 much of the time, it would be dehumanizing to go through living in. I can’t support a facility that facilitates such an isolating experience and is so overpopulated with residents with so little staffing that it forces me to stretch myself so thin in order to get as close to my own standard of what I believe to be “giving care” holistically means, that I began having mental breakdowns after a while as I went through my last shifts.

job_title: Nurse Manager in West Columbia, SC
pros:
LMC is a wonderful organization with gross opportunities and healthy financials. They care about their patients and their employees. Their HR department is professional, fair and engaged in employee and employee issues. It feels good to be a part of such a growing, community oriented organization. 

The onsite daycare is amazing and was the initial reason i wanted to come to LMC.
cons: Top management refuses to deal with poor performers, gross negligence or sheer incompetence. With the job market the way it is, tenure should mean nothing when people are lazy and/or incompetent. Audits and visibility to real issue are difficult to pinpoint, but even when they are voiced, and proven true, nothing is done about it. Unfortunately, this creates unnecessary frustration and takes away from us caring completely for our patients.

review_title: Nice place to work if you can afford it
job_title: Salaried in West Columbia, SC
pros:
Wonderful co-workers, and beautifully taken care of facility and grounds.  There is enough parking and the food in the cafes is affordable and tasty.  
Co-workers are courteous to our patients and their families and anxious to provide excellent care. 
Co-workers are respectful to each other and are team oriented.
Medical equipment is excellent and well maintained and updated regularly.
cons:
Wages are at the low end of the range.  New employees are starting at higher,market level salaries and long time employees (5+ years) cap out their salaries.
We do not get cost of living raises and are often paid below the new hires rates.
However, this hospital does give bonuses each year!

We are starting to lose new candidates to other hospitals because our starting pay is below the market value, even  though they just announced their most profitable year ever.

review_title: Not a bad place to work
job_title: ICU RN in West Columbia, SC
pros:
Good team work among my coworkers.

Most of the staff from other departments worked well with my department.

My department manager was helpful and pleasant to work with.

Most of the Physicians I worked with were good to work with and cared about the patients.

The education department knew what they were doing and provided useful 
classes.
cons:
The number of nurses aides was reduced based on patient load.

Safety issues and concerns took a while to get addressed and resolved so they wouldn't happen again.  Often the only time something was done quickly to resolve the issue was when someone could die or be seriously injured because of the issue.

Hospital resources seemed to be limited especially after 5 PM on weekdays and on weekend or holidays.  As the hospital is growing they need to make those resources available 24/7 instead of making people be called in from home to do routine tests on patients.

job_title: Clinical Dietitian in Lexington, SC
pros: Great coworkers, very fair starting pay for a dietitian, good team of dietitians (though turnover is high), company is very prompt and structurally organized, electronic charting system, relatively flexible schedule that will work around doctor's appointments, etc.  Discounted and affordable cafeteria meals.
cons: PTO accrues very slowly (~16 days off per year for a FT employee).  Only three holidays (Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day, and New Years Day) and as a non-essential personnel, we were required to take PTO those days.  Micromanaging administration.  Schedule changed from flexible to rigid (we had to clock-in 5 minutes before or after our scheduled clock-in time). Poor food quality and many missing items on trays, leading to endless resident complaints. Required to attend time-consuming events (care plan meetings, wound rounds, weight meetings, soon-to-be clinical rounds, etc.).  Also required to call a resident's responsible party after making any change in a resident's diet or supplements. Lots of pressure from administration on the chief clinical dietitian.  Always lots of on-going changes. High turnover in the nutrition services department and in the kitchen.

job_title: Enviremental Assitant in West Columbia, SC
pros: there really isn't a lot of pros. But there is always overtime if you ever need some extra money and the health insurance is fantastic. Along with vacation time.
cons: One of the biggest cons in the housekeeping / environmental services department is the floor equipment. We don't have almost anything to work with. We have 2 ride on floor scrubbers that have been broken for months and they have still yet to fix them. We currently only have 3 working side by side buffers. 2 that are 30 years old or older. And also no proper carpet care equipment. They expect us to do fantastic work when we have almost nothing to work with. Its very frustrating. There is also a lot of favoritism in the department along with politics & nothing you ever do is good enough. The hospital is constantly upgrading various equipment in the the hospital whether its for patients or not. But when it comes to environmental services they never have any budget for it.

job_title: Business Office Associate in West Columbia, SC
pros: there was always work to be done, being able to help people that were in need of it
cons: co-workers/management of practice treated me poorly, gossip between co-workers, rude patients

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Columbia, SC
pros: Normal business hours - didn't expect employees to work beyond normal schedule
cons: Two groups of people - Group 1 = those that have been there forever and know nothing else and Group 2 = those that leave after a short stay because of frustration with Group 1.  First time I worked for a government entity and now know why private sector people make fun of government workers.  Group 1 is stuck in the past, has no desire to change and have zero motivation to better things.  Required contributions to state of SC Pension Plan will drain you - but you get to support those in Group 1!

job_title: Administrative Assistant in West Columbia, SC
pros: Good benefits, pay is somewhat decent but they need to revamp the pay scale.
cons: If your not a VP or someone high on the food chain, your nothing to the company.  Way too political.  The management doesn't really care what you contribute.  If you make the wrong person mad, watch your back.  Employees are not treated equal, salary and hourly employees are treated very different.  Promotions only come to those who know someone, so if you intend to move up in this organization better learn how to brown nose!

review_title: Great Benefits, Great People, Not So Great Pay.
job_title: Assistant in West Columbia, SC
pros: The best part about working for Lexington Medical is the medical benefits, etc. The second would be the people. You will find some of the most personable and caring people you may ever meet. The senior staff are family people. They value morals and a hard working individual. Another part of Lexington Medical is that they allow good flexibility depending on the job. They are a growing company so you know you have job security. The only downsides in my mind would be that as more practices are being added to Lexington Medical and more staff, the senior management levels are in great need of expansion as well.
cons: Not many advancement opportunities. Not competitive pay.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Columbia, SC
pros: Encouraging environment with coworkers that are more like family. Opportunities for advancement. Yearly merit increases. Opportunities to take initiative and show creativity.
cons: None. I have truly enjoyed the decision to work at Lexington and want to make a career here!

review_title: Great to get patient care experience if you don't want to be a CNA.

cons: Pushing beds, assist with transferring patients it can be hard on your back. Being looked down upon as being some that only "pushes beds around". On busy days it can be stressful and sometimes overwhelming.

review_title: Sad to see the changes that are taking place...

review_title: Lexington can be a good place to work if you don’t care about clinical ladder advancement.

pros: Great benefits, competitive salaries, state retirement participation. Fast growing facility with many job openings. Stable staffing with a solid clinical education team.
cons: Lacking in opportunities for clinical advancement. Upper nursing management is far removed from staff nursing. Most staff nurses have no idea who our CNO is.

job_title: Business Office Associate in West Columbia, SC
pros: Dedicated co-workers, good benefits with full time position, mostly approachable management and physicians, cares about patient experience and patient care, stays on top of medical advances, staff is quick to volunteer for community events
cons: can be difficult to balance work/life due to under staffing, individual offices differ wildly with regards to middle management - some are excellent and some are difficult to work for and upper management sometimes seems out of touch

job_title: Histotechnologist in Lexington, SC
pros: Some of the best reasons to work at LMC is the people.  I love the people I work with.  Always willing to help out to get the job done.
cons: Some of the Cons to working at LMC is the general feeling that change is a bad thing.  No one likes change but in order to improve changes must always be made.  There is also a lack of accountability when it comes to getting work done in a timely manner.

review_title: If you are looking for good pay, find a job at Lexington Medical Center
job_title: in Columbia, SC
pros: They try to work with your situation.  They pay very well and they try to keep their pay above other companies of a similar nature.  Their pre-school is the best, and lots of people keep their jobs at the hospital just because they have the pre-school on site.
cons: Dead beat employees were not repremanded.  Those that worked hard often had to pick up the slack of those who were lazy.

job_title: Care Giver in Lexington, SC
pros: Patient care is important to Mgmt and of course the Doctors. The culture is "we are great and care for our patients"
cons: Look at the chairs and couches our patients sit on- stains, nasty spots. The carpet is filthy dirty. Just look at it!! I wish Management would realize that the carpet spots and furniture spots and dirty conditions 'represents' the Hospital!

job_title: Business Office Associate in Lexington, SC
pros: Depending on your management you will learn a lot. There are lots of classes to take and opportunities to learn on your own. Benefits are really great. Free blood screening on your birthday.
cons: Pretty big turnover. Always expanding, but you don't see your paychecks expanding with it. Classes are held in Lexington so if you live or work in one of the clinics on the other side of town it can be a real bummer.

job_title: Practice Manager in Lexington, SC
pros: Close to home. Great patients. I cannot think of 20 words.
cons: Drs. Are treated like Gods with no consequences for how they treat patients or staff. Low pay for high stress. High turn over and never enough staff. Upper mgt does not seem to care about the middle guy that does all the dirty work.

review_title: Fantastic medical organization to work for!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Columbia, SC
pros: Lexington has great people with a wonderful feeling of the whole organization working as a team. When issues occur, they place focus on fixing them, not placing blame.
cons: Despite trying, I cannot think of any cons large enough to point out – the worst that can be thought of is the 5 pm traffic surrounding the hospital, but even this is not that bad!

job_title: Social Work in Lexington, SC
pros:
Amazing staff
Top notch care
Attention to families desires and needs 
Thorough assessments conducted regularly 
Positive atmosphere that allowed patients to thrive and enjoy there time in the facility
cons: None. Incredible environment. Many residents are at the final stages of life, which can be difficult for some employees, but this facility is so positive and uplifting that it makes the difficult time just a little more comfortable for everyone involved.

job_title: Health Information Specialist in Lexington, NC
pros: i enjoy working in health information , which makes me good at what i do,  i take company values to heart and feel that i grow with knowledge   . i like vacation time i feel like every one needs a break
cons: learning new systems , i worked with mccession for six years hospital started new system epic and mastered what was expected of me.

job_title: Medical Office Technician in Lexington, SC
pros: very professional work environment and great staff and management. Fun comfortable place to be employed they really know how to treat their staff
cons: More in depth with training for new grads with no experience. Have more classes to prepare for ehr and other systems in use for you job

job_title: Medical Office Technician in Lexington, SC
pros: Great network of physicians, a lot of transition potential
cons: Hard to get pay increases, little appreciation for good employees, employees who break rules don't have consequences so there's no motivation to do well

job_title: in West Columbia, SC
pros: great benefits, a lot of paid time off, easy to request time off, decent management, they are very fair.  everything you purchase at the hospital is pay-deductable. Pay rates are very decent. part time employees are always offered extra hours when others need off.
cons: sometimes understaffed. training was not sufficient enough.

job_title: RN-STAFF NURSE in West Columbia, SC
pros: I really feel like my manager listens to her staff and backs us up. My co-workers are fabulous. I love my unit. Lots of room for career development.
cons: I work on a med/surg for needles to say it can be extremely busy. Patients and their families can be a real challenge at times.

review_title: New CEO this site needs updating
job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Columbia, SC
pros: friendly coworkers, pleasant atmosphere
cons: Senior level management appears reactionary, disorganized at times and doesnt seem to do much strategic planning.

job_title: Registered Nurse in Columbia, SC
pros: Benefits, coworkers, multiple offices, growing
cons: If you’re not all in you may just find yourself out of a job!!

job_title: Registered Nurse in Pune
pros: secure workplace.  small a long time ago.  close to home.  good opportunities for learning and saw lots of different health issues, learned a great deal.
cons: The locator devices did not help with employee morale.  Busy work environment, not always well staffed, often required to do your job and others.

job_title: Limited Radiographer in Gurgaon, Haryana
pros: Work at a Family Practice and it allows me to do more than just X-ray. I am able to work patients up an work in the lab.
cons: Do not really have any other than we only get paid for what our job title is. But in an office setting we are required to do so much more.

review_title: This is a great entry level position!
job_title: Patient Access Representative in Pune
pros: The patient interaction is a great bonus to working this job.  The day's caseload offers a lot of variety, keeping you engaged throughout the day.
cons: In such a fast paced environment, communication can be challenging at times.  Keeping this in mind and remaining flexible, helps to overcome this challenge.

job_title: Patient Service Representative in Pune
pros:
Great Benefits
Management cares
Pay is good
Harmony among the staff
cons:
You have to fight for a parking space
Additional responsibilities seem to add continuously.
At time can be over staffed in the Dept. that staff is fighting to have a place to sit.

job_title: Appointment Scheduler in Pune
pros: The staff was very kind and understanding. The options and benefits were also very nice. Good pay.
cons: During the holidays work became very stressful. Seniority seemed to someone's get in the way, but extremely rarely.

job_title: Clinical Documentation Specialist in Pune
pros: The company invests back into employees. They believe in promoting from within, and help with continued growth. Benefits are competitive
cons: Healthcare is challenging in general.  State retirement is required in some position which  i do not believe is fair as it should be a choice

review_title: Everything I have experienced at Lmc is over the top wonderful.
job_title: CMA in Pune
pros: The care and compassion from the front desk to Doctor visit.
cons: Needs to be more personable.

job_title: Business Office Associate in Columbia, SC
pros: They provided a lot of on the job training. I gained a lot of skills because of the opportunities they provided.
cons: Not a fan of the office spaces I worked in. There was so little day lighting (lack of windows) that made the days drag.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Columbia, SC
pros: Stable employment.  Clean environment.  All shifts available depending on line of work.
cons: No career growth unless its nursing.  Diversity has improved but still has a ways to go.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Columbia, SC
pros: Excellent employer.  Growing daily with the same excellent patient caring service that they have always given.  Long term staff retention
cons: I do not have any negative comments to say about such a wonderful employer.

job_title: Student Nurse Technician in West Columbia, SC
pros: My unit offered multiple shifts of varied lengths and they worked around my class schedule. The staff were all very supportive and helpful
cons: At times, my manager could be difficult to get a hold of because she had so many meetings during the day

job_title: Business Office Associate in West Columbia, SC
pros: PTO, benefits, personal growth within LMC, also lots of other perks.
cons: Where I'm at Currently I don't like the hours, but it's what I agreed to. I can't say anything bad. They give you lots of PTO !

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Lexington, SC
pros: Benefits were good.  Training was good.  Supervisors were fair.  Employees were kind to each other and helpful on a professional level.
cons: A lot of stress among dept. heads.  Department heads and upwards were out of touch.  FAR too much focus on community image.  Def cliques. among employees and even employees and supervisors.  Low employee morale.  Human Resources protect department heads,

job_title: ED Tech II in Lynchburg, VA
pros: Lots of friendly  people. Good benefits and salary increases. Opportunities for growth. Wish I could stay here forever.
cons: Not too many things to name here. Hours can get long but that's at any hospital as you may know.

job_title: in Lexington, SC
pros: Great group of people to work with. Truly put patients care first and sincerely
cons: Like everywhere, productivity is pushed hard

review_title: LMC is a great place tow ork
job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Columbia, SC
pros: You are offered great benefits.Almost all employees are respectful and friendly. They have an on-site daycare. Most positions are well compensated.
cons: Time-off policies are somewhat strict depending on the department. It is a very political environment.

job_title: Payer Relations Representative in Columbia, SC
pros: Small office space, free coffee
cons: Management, coworkers who share too much, talk too much and gossip. Pay not great for position and benefits not great, decent at best

review_title: So far, the workplace environment seems very friendly and professional.
job_title: Revenue Cycle Associate in West Columbia, SC
pros: Large organization, seems like a lot of room for advancement.
cons: I have not experienced any problems so far, but I have only just been hired.

job_title: Technical Director in Lexington, SC
pros: I enjoyed working and experiencing the clinical setting and the learning experience was very valuable
cons: Too much run like a business

job_title: in West Columbia, SC
pros: Enjoy caring for the patients.  Thankful they allow therapy dogs to work with our patients.  They are expanding so hopefully new work options will become available.
cons: Time off is restricted and hard to get.  Employees here are just a number. Have been told that no one is irreplaceable which comes across as a threat.

job_title: Practice Manager in Summerville, SC
pros: Large organization with huge potential
cons: Some favoritism with upper management and those that get ahead. Good networking between depts

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Kernersville, NC
pros:
Organization made you feel like a family

job_title: Radiologic Technologist in Lexington, SC
pros: There are a few great co-workers to team work with.
cons: Management doesn't care what actual patient care workers suggest.They want things their own realistic way, and whoever peppers with them is favored.

review_title: Great place to work! I love my co-workers.
job_title: Nursing Technician II in Lexington, SC

cons: Training could have been better. (on my floor - hospital orientation was fine)

job_title: Business Office Associate in Columbia, SC

job_title: Anonymous Employee in West Columbia, SC
